title: Start
body:
#Act 1; Scene 1
:___ Business Park, OK Tacos truck, 11:45am
#Load Anya
Aanya:
#* indicates I need italics for this line. (inner monologue)
Aanya*:
Aanya:Hi there! What can I get for ya?
#Load Ruth
????:O-hi. Could I get... two carne asada tacos and a... cherry Funta?
Aanya:Sure, coming right up!
Aanya*:Isn't her earring from Parallax Eons? It looks like the Redfield crest.
????:Oh! Sorry, but could you hold the peppers, onions, cilantro, salsa, and side carrots?
Aanya*:So... plain...
Aanya:So, just plain beef tacos, yes?
????:Errr... yeah. Thanks.
Aanya*:Well, guess this taco is already... too seasoned.
Aanya*:Maybe Boss will let me have it for lunch...
Aanya:Here you go, enjoy!
????:Thanks, you too.
#Ruth embarrassed
????:...
Aanya*:I-i'm sorry!
Aanya:Uh... I really love your earring! Glory to the Redfields!
#Ruth Excite
????:Declare victory!
Aanya*:Ah. She does play. And she must play on the Redfield servers.
#Ruth startled
????:!!!
#Ruth embarrassed
????:.....
#Aanya Sorry
Aanya*:...I guess I got a little carried away...
Aanya: Umm... here's some napkins and... um... a fork.
????:...thanks...
Aanya:...
Aanya*:I should... apologize.
Aanya:Oh hey, the line's gone. Hey Boss. Can I take my lunch now?
Boss:*nod*
Aanya:Hey Boss. Can I have this mis-taco?
Boss:*nod*
Aanya:Thanks boss. I'll be back in 30.
#Change background here
#Load Ruth
Aanya:Hi again! Mind if I sit here?
????:!!!
????:Go ahead.
Aanya:Thanks. Sorry about my... antics. I got a little carried away.
????:N-no, it's okay.
????:...
Aanya:...
????:.....*munch*
Aanya:.....
Aanya*:Do I... say anything?
->I really should...
    Aanya:...
    ????:...
    Aanya:.....
->Say something...
->But...
    Aanya:...
    ????:...
    Aanya:.....
Aanya:So you play Parallax?
Aanya*:Wow. Just... wow.
????:Yeah.
????:...
Aanya:.....
Aanya*:Erm... what now?
->"Nice weathe-"
    ????:D-
    Aanya:Nic-
    Aanya*:Crap.
    Aanya:Go ahead, you first.
    ????:Mm.
->Am I seriously gonna talk about the weather?@timer@550
????:Do you play?
Aanya:Yup. My parent's got me a GS Rita for Christmas last year, and this was the promo game it had.
#Ruth shake
????:Wait, you got the promo version!? Lucky... that came with the GS exclusive 'Intention Flux' armor set...
Aanya*:It did have that armor, didn't it?
->It wasn't as strong as the armor set I already had...
    Aanya:The promo set wasn't really that strong though.
    ????:Isn't it better that way? Like really strong items can only be obtained by hard work.
    Aanya*:Or money.
    Aanya:I've found it kinda weird that a lot of the so-called legendary items aren't as good as some of the rare ones, though.
    ????:But if everyone just picked the strongest item, the game would look really... silly. I mean, I still use 'Paradox Manual' even though 'Matter Formula' is strictly better.
    ????:Sometimes you just want to use an item that your character would enjoy!
    Aanya*:Like all the players that wear cosmetic armor into battle for... roleplaying?
->It still looked really cool.
    Aanya:The art they used for it was really beautiful.
    ????:Right? The lore behind the set sent shivers down my spine! I think the Masked Queen is one of my favorite NPCs.
    Aanya:She was the one that turned all of the captured prisoners into mirror copies of herself, right?
    Aanya*:I also believe that was the fight that everyone complained about because it was way too hard...
    ????:Yeah! I just loved how atmospheric the fight felt.
    ????:I mean, until you were ganked by a dozen copies.
    ????:But the throne room her fight was in... the detail in all the chains running across the floor...
    ????:You felt in the presence of a real queen.
#Ruth ringtone
????:Ah.
????:I gotta head back to work. Maybe I'll see you again?
Aanya*:No doubt, i'm here Monday through Friday.
Aanya:Most likely.
Aanya:...
Aanya*:She was a nice person.
Aanya*:...
Aanya:I forgot to ask her name.
#END SCENE 1
[[Act1_Scene2_s]]

title: Act1_Scene2_s
body:
#Act 1; Scene 2
:The Next Day...
:___ Business Park, OK Tacos Truck, 11:45am
#Load Aanya
Aanya:Green, red, or purple salsa?
Probably Becky:All of them.
Aanya*:A-all of them? Really?
Aanya:Alright, here you are. Have a good one!
Probably Becky:You too! Thanks a ton.
#Load Ruth
Aanya*:Oh hey, it's...
->that girl that ordered plain tacos.
    Aanya*:Sh-should I really be remembering her like that?
->that girl that declared victory a la Redfield.
    Aanya*:I mean, it was memorable...
->that girl who really likes Parallax Eons.
    Aanya*:I wonder if she's played to new patch yet...
Aanya*:I... should really ask her real name.
Aanya:Hey, how's it going? I didn't catch your name yesterday. I'm Aanya.
Ruth:Ruth.
Aanya:Ruth, huh? What can I get for ya?
Aanya*:Two carne asada tacos and a cherry Funta, hold the veggies and salsa... probably.
Ruth:I'll have two carne asada tacos and a cherry Funta, hold the veggies and salsa please.
Aanya*:Called it!
Aanya:Alrighty, that'll be three dollars.
Aanya:Here you are! 
Ruth:Thanks. I'll... see ya?
#Hide Ruth
Aanya*:I wonder if Boss'll let me take my lunch now.
Boss:*nod*
Aanya:...
Aanya:*nod*
Aanya*:D-did I say that out loud? I'm pretty sure I didn't...
Aanya*:...a-anyway...tacos. Plaaaain tacos.
#Load Ruth
Aanya:Heya! Boss let me take my lunch now. If you don't mind, can I eat with you?
Ruth:Oh! Sure.
Aanya:I was wondering, but... do you work in one of the office buildings near here?
Ruth:Mm. I work in the 3T building, doing customer service work.
Ruth:...
Ruth:It's boring, but I ought to count myself as lucky to even have steady work in this era.
Aanya:You also have some moderately delicious tacos just down the way too!
Ruth:That too. But aside from that...
Aanya:Hm?
Ruth:Did you play the new patch for Parallax? They added some new content stuff and a few quests.
Aanya:No, not yet. It was still downloading when I woke up today, so I was going to play it when I got home.
Aanya*:Speaking of... I should probably complain to my net provider...
Ruth:I haven't either. If you don't have work tomorrow, do you wanna party up? We could meet at the net cafe and play the new raids.
Aanya:What time would we be meeting up? I'm... not really an early riser on weekends if I don't have to.
Ruth: I was thinking around 2 or so.
Aanya*:About an hour to get ready... then half and hour...
Aanya:Sounds good to me. Just in case, wanna trade phone numbers?
Ruth:Sure. Oh, and texting is okay for me.
Aanya:Same.
Aanya*:Huh, her phone number has three sevens in a row...
Aanya: There.
Ruth:Great! I saw online that they were making it a double xp weekend on top of the new content patch, so I wanted to ask you today.
Aanya*:It's been a while since i've taken advantage of the party up bonus rewards, too...
#Ruth Alarm
Aanya:So i'll see you tomorrow at... Infinium?
Ruth:Yeah, that one's the most comfortable. 2 o'clock then!
Aanya:Yup, seeya!
Aanya*:I... probably shouldn't get a head start on the patch.
Aanya*:...
->I really shouldn't...
    [[Act1_Scene3_a]]
->It wouldn't be fair...
    [[Act1_Scene3_a]]
->I mean... maybe just the solo content...
    [[Act1_Scene3_b]]
#END SCENE 2

title: Act1_Scene3_a
body:
#Act 1; Scence 3; Route a
:Infinium Net Cafe, 1:55pm
Aanya*:This place looks nicer than the net cafe I visit. You can actually see through the windows.
Aanya*:...
Aanya*:Oh, there she is.
Ruth:*waves*
Ruth:You didn't wait too long, did you?
Aanya:Hm? No, not at all. Just a few minutes, actually. Shall we?
Ruth:*nod*
[[Act1_Scene3_s]]

title: Act1_Scene3_b
body:
#Act 1; Scene 3; Route b
:Infinium Net Cafe, 2:32pm
Aanya:*gasp* *huff*
Ruth:Hey, you made it.
Aanya:Sorry i'm... *pant* late.
Ruth:No problem, I only got here a little while ago myself.
Aanya*:I think Lady Karma had it out for me. I probably shouldn't have started the solo content last night.
Ruth:Shall we? Or do you need a little more fresh air?
Aanya:I'm good. I think...
[[Act1_Scene3_s]]

title: Act1_Scene3_s
body: #Update Background Aanya*:It's... ->Cleaner than I'm used to... Aanya:It's really clean here. Ruth:I like it because it feels... cozy, y'know? Some other places are cramped with a ton of bright neon lights and stuff. Ruth:But here you can actually relax. They even have pastries! Aanya*:Can't say no to pastries. ->Quieter, too... Aanya:I was expecting more noise. Ruth:The manager here told me that the reason for the headphones policy was so each person could enjoy whatever world they wanted to without distraction. Aanya:That's... actually pretty cool. Manager:Ruth! Good to see you again! Ruth:*nod* Mm. O-oh! This is my friend Aanya. I don't think she's been here...? Aanya:I haven't. Nice to meet ya... err... Manager:You can just call me Manager. Aanya*:Ooookay? Just Manager? I don't... Aanya:Alrighty, Manager. Manager:You've got a good friend, Ruth! Anything I can get set up for you folk? Ruth:Nope, we're playing the new patch for Parallax today. Manager:In that case, happy raiding! Glory to the Redfields! Almost Everyone: Declare Victory!!! Aanya*:Wow, this whole place is Redfield territory isn't it. Ruth:Over here Aanya, we can use these cushions. Aanya:Okay. Ruth:So. Aanya*:Ruth looks... serious. ->Hmm... "Yes, captain?"... Aanya:Yes, captain? Ruth:Ahem. Your captain would like to know about your class and stats, in order to properly prepare for today's battle. Aanya*:She took that in stride really quick. ->Or maybe "My Queen?"... Aanya:My Queen? Ruth:My faithful steward, pray tell me of thy class and stats, that we may triumph in the coming battle. Aanya*:She knows what she's doing, that's for sure. ->Hold on, i'm getting a bit caught up in all this. Aanya:So...? Ruth:Your class and stats! We can't go into a raid without knowing each other's capabilities. That's just common sense. Aanya:Right, that makes sense. Here. Ruth:So you're a Guardian Knight type, huh? That's a relief! Aanya:You play a casting class? Ruth:Yeah, Reverent Wizard type. Specializing in both DoTs and party healing! My equipment is mainly focusing on the DoT though. Ruth:I liked the playstyle that came with it. You stack up a lot of damage when the fight first starts, then switch over to heals until the DoT wears off. Ruth:I guess... it keeps me engaged with all parts of a raid, both allies and enemies. Aanya:Huh. I guess the pure damage classes only have to worry about their enemies health and their own cooldowns. And even the guardian only really needs to keep an eye on enemy aggro. Ruth:The only class that doesn't really need to pay any attention is the Aegis Bulwark. Aanya:Yeah, it just stands there. Aanya*:I can't possibly say that I was originally going to play one... Ruth:So, you ready to start the raid? Aanya:Yup. I'm loaded in. Ruth:Great! I'll go ahead and let you take aggro as soon as we get inside. Ruth:...! Ruth:Wow!!! Look at the size of that thing! And the detail in it's wings! Aanya*:Great... a flying raid boss... this'll be a pain. Aanya:Alright! I'm taking aggro! Ruth:Laying down my damage, will switch to heals after. Aanya*:You know... Ruth:Aanya, you're buffed! Switch to damage! Aanya:R-right! Aanya*:This is... Ruth:Oh crap, it's spawning minions. Aanya, can you tank those? Aanya:Already on it. Can give me Molten Eternia? Ruth:For sure! Aanya*:A lot of fun. #END SCENE 3 [[Act1_Scene4_s]]

title: Act1_Scene4_s
body:
#Act 1; Scene 4
:At home, 10:40pm
Aanya*:Aah... today was a good day...
Aanya*:Huh. I guess I hadn't really made any new friends since I graduated. Most of the people I know went their separate ways.
Aanya*:...
Aanya*:Ruth's a fun person, I hope we can hang out more...
Aanya*:...
Aanya:Hm? A text?
Aanya*:It's from Ruth.
Ruth:"Thanks for hanging out today! If you're working on Monday i'll see you then? (^u^)b"
Aanya*:Her texting is pretty... cute.
Aanya*:Hmmm... what to say...
->"I'll see you monday :)"
    Aanya*:I hope she doesn't think i'm too... old-school with my emoticons....
->What about "Yup! ^_^b"?
    Aanya*:It's honestly been a while since i've used these...
->Hmm... this is too hard.
    Aanya*:Yeah, i'll see her Monday.
    [[Act2_Scene1_s]]
->Screw it, I'll see her on Monday.
    Aanya*:I'm pretty tuckered out, anyway.
    [[Act2_Scene1_s]]
Aanya:There.
Aanya*:I guess i'm pretty Parallax'd out. Maybe i-
Aanya:!
Aanya:Another text?
Ruth:"Awesome! Have you checked your quest log yet? It looks like we got a new one for completing that raid!"
Aanya*:I didn't yet, but i'll check it tomor- whattheheckanothertext?
Ruth:"It spans like 5 continents!!! (o wO);"
Aanya*:...
->It'd be nice...
    Aanya:Lessee... "Why don't we hang out again this Saturday?"
    Aanya:...
    Aanya*:Ah, she replied.
    Ruth:"Yes! :D"
->To hang out again...
    Aanya:"Why don't we hang out again this Saturday?" Sent.
    Aanya:...
    Aanya*:Ah, she replied.
    Ruth:"Yes! :D"
->Next Saturday...
    Aanya:"Why don't we hang out again this Saturday?" aaand... sent!
    Aanya:...
    Aanya*:Ah, she replied.
    Ruth:"Yes! :D"
->Not like I have other plans...@timer@2000
    Aanya*:Dang, she texts fast.
    Ruth:"Do you wanna go to the net cafe again next Saturday!?"
    Aanya*:She's thinking the same thing I was...
    Aanya:"Sure!"
#END SCENE 4
[[Act2_Scene1_s]]

title: Act2_Scene1_s
body: #Act 2; Scene 1 :Three weeks later... Aanya*:Oh, I see Ruth in line. Aanya:Hey Ruth! What can I get for you? Ruth:Hm? Hey Aanya. I'll just have the usual, thanks. Aanya*:...It looks like she's had a rough day at work. Aanya:Here you go. Hey Bo- Boss:*nod* Aanya*:Seriously. How? Aanya:Here you go, Ruth. I got my lunch break, too. Ruth:Is your Boss really that lax? I mean, it seems weird that you can take lunch with me every week. Aanya:To be honest, it is a little strange. They are normally really strict, especially when the line is really long. Aanya:But when it comes to you, Boss is really... lenient. Aanya:I mean, you do come at the end of the lunch rush, and it's not like my job is really that hard. I just warm up things, for the most part. Aanya*:I think I get it but... Ruth:You're... so lucky. Aanya:Did you have a rough day at work? Ruth:... Ruth:I'm just really, really tired, that's all. Thanks, though. Really. Aanya:Okay. If you need to talk, just let me know. Ruth:*nod* Ruth:...Is your job fun? Aanya:Hmm... I guess it's pretty fun. I mean, not in the way that games are, but- Ruth:More of a contentment thing? Aanya:Yeah. Boss is nice, and most of the people I run across are at worst annoying. And at best, I get to make new friends, right? Ruth:The people I deal with always want me to instantly solve their problems. I wish they would just realize that I can't just turn it off and back on again for them. Ruth:And there are the people who blame you for not being able to solve their problems, even though they are the one's that got themselves into that mess in the first place! Ruth:I really can't stand the people that take their own stupid problems out on those trying to help them. It's just... rude. Aanya*:I know that feeling. There's always some jerk who thinks they are above you. I've considered having a special hot sauce just for those people. Ruth:I wish more people gave a damn about treating each other right. Most of us who work there just want to live our lives free of shit like that. Ruth:Why should I have to keep saying "yes ma'am" or "i'm sorry, ma'am" to someone who treats me like that? Aanya:Have you tried talking with your managers? I went to a customer service training a while back when I first started up at the truck. There was a list of rules for maintaining workplace safety alongside good service standards. Aanya:One of the baseline rules was: "Don't accept abuse from customers." Aanya:Managers are usually trained to handle disruptive customers, so they'd rather deal with them in a way that satisfies everyone as best as possible without risking a hurt employee. Aanya:Not to mention avoiding physical violence. Ruth:But I did try that. When I said I was going to get my manager to help, the customer just lashed out at me, telling me that I should be fired for not knowing how to fix their stupid problem. Aanya:But that- Ruth:And once my manager finished talking to them, she just told me to "toughen up", as if it were my fault for not being able to handle that. Aanya:You shouldn't... i'm sorry about that. That really sucks. Ruth:It's just... #Ruth alarm Ruth:... Ruth:..... Aanya:Umm... Ruth:................ Ruth:...I don't wanna... #ruth_cry :'( Ruth:I don't want to go back! Ruth:I...I just...*sniff*... can't do it anymore... Aanya*:I should... no. I want to say something. She shouldn't go back to work like this, no telling what could happen. Aanya:Ruth, what's your work's phone number? I'll call you out sick. They can't make you work if you're ill, and it looks to me like you could use some rest. Ruth:*sniff* But... Aanya:You live by the C-Line, right? I'll take you back home, alright? Ruth:*nod* *sniff* Aanya:Boss! I'm going to take Ruth home, okay? Boss:*thumbs up* Aanya*:Thanks, Boss. Aanya:Let's see... Ruth. Let me know when we get to your stop, okay? Ruth:*nod* #END SCENE 1 [[Act2_Scene2_s]]

title: Act2_Scene2_s
body: #Act 2; Scene 2 :At Ruth's apartment, 12:35pm Aanya:Hey, Ruth. You're home. Ruth:...thanks, Aanya. Really. Aanya: Do you want anything? Do you have any tea? Ruth:Mm. There's some chamomile in the cabinet. The furthest left one. Aanya:Alright. I'll heat some up for us. Aanya*:It seemed like her work was alright with her going home. Maybe it's because I called instead of her. Aanya*:Though they seem like a pretty crappy place to work, from what i've heard. Aanya*:What sort of company would make their employees go through stuff like this? Aanya*:... Aanya*:I mean... most of them. But that's not the point! Aanya*:First things first, I should help Ruth calm down. #Load Ruth Aanya:Here you go. It's like... Inferno-level hot though. I don't understand what the water did to deserve that. Ruth:Heh, dunno. Thanks for the tea. Aanya:No problem. That's what friends are for, right? Tea? Ruth:Something like that. Ruth:... Aanya:... Ruth:Aanya? Aanya:Hm? Ruth:What makes you so happy? Aanya:I-I don' really know how to answer that. Like... I guess my family is important to me, and i'm happy when I go see them. Aanya:Hanging out at the net cafe with you has been really fun, too. Aanya*:I... get the feeling I didn't really answer her question, though... Ruth:I... used to think that when I graduated, i'd find a job and then the adult in me would be happy. I guess I thought that what I considered happiness would change once I did everything I was expected to do. Ruth:But it didn't. Ruth:For a while I was really lost. I didn't have any source of happiness for myself, and found that I was starting to mistreat myself. Ruth:I became anxious whenever I thought about what the future. I never really was able to place myself in it. Ruth:I stopped taking care of my appearance, my nutrition, everything. It got so bad that I nearly lost my job. Ruth:I had been told all my life that once I became an adult I would go to work every day, then come home to my family and that would be my happiness. Ruth:But I didn't have anything to return to. Aanya:But something did change, right? Ruth:I saw a coworker playing Parallax one day, and asked her about it. At that point a lot turned around for me. Ruth:Something about the grind, the hard work that paid off really got me. I started to treat myself like my avatar. Ruth:And it showed. I got myself new work clothes, tried to eat healthier, and got myself into a routine where my life became tolerable again. Ruth:And for a while, that worked. At work, I would just do my job, and at home I would focus on taking care of myself. Aanya:That's pretty admirable, honestly. Ruth:I'm not admirable. Aanya:W-what do you mean? Ruth:... Ruth:.....I... Ruth:I just... Ruth:I thought that after all that effort I put in, someone would give a damn. Ruth:I thought that if I structured my life and cleaned myself up that I would be accepted! Ruth:But instead I just feel... alone. I'm financially stable, reasonably healthy, but I... Ruth:But I just get trodden on by people who don't even know me. Ruth:No one even knows how hard it was to push myself like that. And worse... Ruth:No one cared. And it sort of made sense to me! Ruth:Why should I do so much when no one even sees me trying? Aanya:Ruth... Ruth:But what do you know? One day some weird girl working at a taco truck sat and ate lunch with me. I was so close, Aanya! So close to throwing away everything that I had built up for myself! Ruth:But someone gave a damn. Ruth:Sounds pretty dumb, huh? As natural as breathing, she sat down and gave me everything that I was about to close myself off to. Aanya:... Ruth:You cared... Ruth:I just- ->Hug Ruth [[Act2_Scene3_s]] ->...@timer@450 Ruth:*sniff* I was so close to giving up! ->Hug Ruth [[Act2_Scene3_s]] ->...@timer@450 Ruth:I was about to isolate myself from everyone! ->Hug Ruth [[Act2_Scene3_s]] ->...@timer@450 Ruth:*sniff* ...be lonely... ->Hug Ruth [[Act2_Scene3_s]] ->...@timer@450 Ruth:Aanya... ->Hug Ruth [[Act2_Scene3_s]] ->...@timer@450 Ruth:I hate... Aanya*:Ruth... ->Hug Ruth [[Act2_Scene3_s]] #End Scene 2

title: Act2_Scene3_s
body:
Aanya:Come here.
Ruth:*sniff* ...
Aanya:Is is all right if I touch your hair?
Ruth:*sniff* Mmhmm.
Aanya:...
Aanya*:Ruth...
Aanya:Do you feel a little bit better, now that all that's off your chest?
Ruth:A-a little bit *sniff*
Aanya:Listen. If you need someone to listen to you- about anything- i'm here. Okay? I can't really do much about your work, or about the people you have to help.
Aanya:But I can lend an ear and a shoulder, if you want. In fact, i'd prefer if you do.
Aanya:But I also know that you are incredibly strong. What you told me proves that, without a doubt.
Aanya:I don't think that strength and being helped are mutually exclusive. The opposite, in fact.
Aanya:I-I guess what i'm saying is don't feel like you are being pigeonholed into one structure of life or another. If you feel that one way of living isn't working, there isn't shame in changing that.
Aanya:I mean, consider the consequences and all but-
Ruth:*chuckle*
Aanya*:I'm... rambling aren't I.
Ruth:You're rambling.
Ruth:But that's okay.
Aanya:You look like you've made yourself comfortable there.
Ruth:Aanya?
Aanya:Hm?
Ruth:Do you want to... spend the night?
Aanya*:OMG
